headline.main: Ratings Decline at 'American Idol' May Have Leveled Off

docs.snippet: The ratings Wednesday night were down from the year before, but in the range of the week before. But, notably, the singing contest will not be No. 1 this week among 18- to 49-year-old viewers....

headline.main: Searching for Political Clues in China's Social Media Censorship

headline.main: Searching for Political Clues in China's Social Media Censorship

docs.snippet: Observers looking for clues about the fate of one of China's most famous mob-busting security officials are watching how the Chinese authorities have, or have not, censored social media posts on the subject....
docs.abstract: Observers looking for clues about the fate of one of China's most famous mob-busting security officials are watching how the Chinese authorities have, or have not, censored social media posts on the subject.
docs.lead_paragraph: Amid a torrent of online rumor, China's state-run Xinhua news agency on Thursday published a terse report confirming that one of China's most famous mob-busting security officials had spent a day at an American consulate.

headline.main: One on One: Adam Lashinsky, Author of 'Inside Apple'

docs.snippet: Excerpts of an interview with Adam Lashinsky, the author of "Inside Apple: How America's Most Admired - and Secretive - Company Really Works," a book published last month....
docs.abstract: Excerpts of an interview with Adam Lashinsky, the author of "Inside Apple: How America's Most Admired - and Secretive - Company Really Works," a book published last month.
docs.lead_paragraph: Adam Lashinsky is the author of "Inside Apple: How America's Most Admired - and Secretive - Company Really Works," a book published last month. While Walter Isaacson's recent best-seller "Steve Jobs" focused on Apple's late co-founder and former chief executive, Mr. Lashinsky's book is  about the company's maniacal emphasis on secrecy, its management practices and other pieces of the blueprint that make Apple successful. The following are excerpts of a conversation with Mr. Lashinsky, who is also a senior editor at large with Fortune magazine:
